sn46.40:4.1: “Mendicants, these five hindrances are destroyers of sight, vision, and knowledge. They block wisdom, they’re on the side of anguish, and they don’t lead to extinguishment.
sn46.40:4.3: Sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt.
sn46.40:4.8: These five hindrances are destroyers of sight, vision, and knowledge. They block wisdom, they’re on the side of anguish, and they don’t lead to extinguishment.
sn46.40:5.1: These seven awakening factors are creators of sight, vision, and knowledge. They grow wisdom, they’re on the side of solace, and they lead to extinguishment.
sn46.40:5.3: The awakening-factors of mindfulness, investigation of principles, energy, rapture, tranquility, samādhi, and equanimity.
sn46.40:5.5: These seven awakening factors are creators of sight, vision, and knowledge. They grow wisdom, they’re on the side of solace, and they lead to extinguishment.”
